articles.author: Cassidy Chisholm
articles.title: N.S. data on 'breakthrough cases' proves COVID-19 vaccines are working, expert says
articles.description: Initial data provided on Friday shows that people who received one dose of the vaccine made up less than five per cent of the overall cases during Nova Scotia's third wave. People who had received both doses made up less than one per cent.
articles.content:
Initial data on "breakthrough cases" proves that COVID-19 vaccines are working in Nova Scotia, according to a researcher at Dalhousie University.

articles.title: Blue-green algae confirmed in Grand Lake, N.S.
articles.description: Toxins associated with blue-green algae have been confirmed in Grand Lake, N.S., but the province's Department of Environment is still awaiting further test results.

articles.author: Erin Pottie
articles.title: Sydney, N.S., doctor and former refugee hanging up his stethoscope at age 84
articles.description: Dr. Navin Patel will retire on June 30 after a career in medicine spanning 57 years.
articles.content:
A family doctor and former refugee from Sydney, N.S., is set to retire later this month, just days shy of his 85th birthday.
Dr. Navin Patel credits good health for keeping him working 20 years past… [+3445 chars]

articles.author: Paul Withers
articles.title: Sable Island undergoing dramatic coastline retreat
articles.description: Beaches are shrinking, and fresh water ponds are disappearing on the southern side of Sable Island amid storm surge, shifting sands and sea level rise.
articles.content: New research shows portions of Sable Island have shrunk dramatically in recent decades at times by ten metres per year on the south side, where several freshwater ponds and a lake disappeared entirel… [+5479 chars]

articles.title: The politics behind the expulsion of Elizabeth Smith-McCrossin
articles.description: Nova Scotia Progressive Conservative Leader Tim Houston told reporters Thursday he was ready to give up a seat that was likely a sure win for his party in the next election. Here's some of the reasons why.
